entry.title: National Hospital Service Reserve (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the British National Hospital Service Reserve (poster pictured) trained volunteers to carry out first aid in the aftermath of a nuclear or chemical attack?

entry.title: a 1917 agreement between France and Russia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 1917 agreement between France and Russia was rendered void within days because of the February Revolution?

entry.title: Maximiliane Brentano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Goethe used his unrequited love to Maximiliane Brentano as inspiration for his novel The Sorrows of Young Werther?

entry.title: Homer House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the cupola of Homer House is part of a 19th-century cooling system?

entry.title: Grant Nel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Grant Nel, at the age of nine, switched from gymnastics to diving after breaking both of his hands?

entry.title: Neary's (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the New York City Police Department shut down highway and bridge traffic for the funeral of the owner of Neary's, an Irish pub?

entry.title: a drone attack by the Houthi military (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a drone attack by the Houthi military hit a target in Tel Aviv, but no sirens were activated?

entry.title: a California TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the general manager of a California TV station canceled the interview show he hosted because of its lack of quality?

entry.title: We Were Searching for a Boy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the regent of the Mongol Empire between 1248 and 1251 was named "We Were Searching for a Boy"?
